channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overcrowding at street entry, 27th October
item.description:
This street needs to have a strict enforcement of parking restrictions and the restrictions must be extended to cover the school pickup times. There is no traffic warden on this street at these times, restrictions are not at all enforced and the entry into the street gets severely impacted due to pick up cars and other people who park to use high street facilities. This is hugely detrimental for the residents who are unable to use the road between 1-5pm. Kindly extend the parking restriction hours on Deepdene Road and make sure this is properly enforced and parking tickets issued for people not following these. Kindly ensure parking wardens are doing their job here
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Deepdene Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Kechill Gardens need leafing, 27th October
item.description:
The pavements in part of Kechill Gardens need leafing. The leaves get very slippery when wet. There are a large number of older people in the area and they are more likely to seriously injure themselves if they slip and fall over. Please would you arrange for all the leaves to be swept up and removed as soon as possible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kechill Gardens, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vibrations felt near this area, 27th October
item.description:
Over the last 4/5 days or so, I have noticed there have been what felt like small vibrations from inside the house, they can also be felt on the second floor of the property. It's noticeable mostly in the late evenings but sporadically during the day too. In case this is an issue known to the Council or if is a known effect of local maintenance work etc. I thought best to report it
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mosslea Road, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned truck with broken windows has no MOT as it expired August 2025, 26th October
item.description:
We reported about this track which has been in the same spot that is not moved since August 2025 and we checked and it has no MOT as it ran out in August 2025. We approached the police and I've been close with the police said to get in touch with you which we are doing please remove this truck from our street. It is full of household flight tipped items and it is dangerous. Just got a broken window and other bits of damage are appearing daily.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Durham Avenue, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gully of road drain blocked, 26th October
item.description:
The road-level grille is fine, kept clear by ourselves and the monthly road sweeper, so a superficial inspection appears ok. However, the gully 4ft below is completely blocked and does not drain, so it ponds at surface level in heavy rain. The grille needs to be removed and the gully cleaned out.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Goodhart Way, Park Langley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street Lamp Post Light Out, 26th October
item.description:
The street lamp light on the lamp post outside #28 Crockham Way is not working
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crockham Way, Coldharbour, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Piles of leaves are getting higher and the abandoned car does not have MOT, 26th October
item.description:
The amount of leaves on our road is getting higher and higher and my garden keeps on filling in with more leaves from the road and the pavement and Bromley Council has completely neglected cleaning our road. Additionally there is an abandoned track which does not have an MOT and we sent the details to Bromley County Bromley police and they say it is your responsibility Bromley Council to do something about it please situ it as soon as possible both the leaves and the truck it's been there since August 2025 and the MOT run out August 2025.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Durham Avenue, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
